summary: They hold the sun withing their eyes. [ These will replace original eyes]
descriptionHtml:
[u][b]
[/b][/u]
[u][b][size=3][b]Requirements:[/b][/size]
[/b][/u]Skyrim
Dawnguard

[u][b]
[color=#ff0000]Woo~ First own mod, hope people like it. Not Lore friendly.[/color]
[/b][/u]
A friend told me most make red and blue vampire eyes. Or glowing yellow.
he wanted yellow but with a twist. So added the sun burnt into them.

[color=#ff7700]Warning : This mod will replace the vampire eyes permantly, want original back you sadly have to download a new vampire eye mod.
Do a back-up always. I don't know how to do a stand-aloneeye mod. [/color]


[size=3][u]Installation:[/u][/size] Use a Mod Manager or...

Manual Installation:
Copy and paste the contents of the .ZIP into your Skyrim Data folder.[size=2][b]
[/b][/size]

[i]ex: C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\common\Skyrim
[/i]





[u][size=3][b]BUGS[/b][/size][/u]
=============

[b]*Sometimes[/b] my texture doesn't replace the original, this is caused by you having another eye mod.
Follow this fix:
[b]-If you have nexus mod manage[/b]: Deactivate the other eye mod, start game and make a clean save ,
Remove my mod, and re-download it [i]( unless you have the zip, re-add it then)

If nothing works to fix the issue, sorry.
My suggestion is to download another vampire eye mod then.[/i]

*If you can't download, I don't know why. Nexus has issues?

*Any other bugs or CTDÂ  maybe is caused by other mods, mine is just a eye texture replacement.


[i](English is not my first language,)[/i]
author: MassiveMaster
